Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as the model module in the MVC architecture
    Version:
    A2
    Author:
    Emily Ashworth, Pavithran Pathmarajah, Ziyi Jin

      • getError

        public static int getError()
        This function returns the most recent error that was raised
        Returns:
        the integer value corresponding to the last error that was raised as

      • getCurBoard

        public static int[] getCurBoard()
        This function returns the entirety of the board positions as requested
        Returns:
        the boardPositions array that holds all the position values

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        This function returns the entirety of the board positions as requested Also restes the move history back to blank

      • moveTrackReset

        public static void moveTrackReset()
        Resets the move history list to a fresh one, called on disk removal since anything prior will not be considered in a cycle check for a draw

      • getMoveTrackingList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getMoveTrackingList()
        getter for the history list so that, the save game can keep track of possible cyclic patterns
        Returns:
        the moveHistory list

        This method is used to find the value at any given position in the board
        Parameters:
        pos - the location in the array to be checked
        Returns:
        the value at that position on the board

      • hasValue

        public static boolean hasValue(int pos)
        This method is used when placing pieces to check if pieces will be overlapped
        Parameters:
        pos - the location in the array to be checked
        Returns:
        a boolean stating if a piece is there or not

      • setValue

        public static void setValue(int pos,
                            int val)
        This method is to allow other classes to change values of the display board
        Parameters:
        pos - the location in the array to be changed
        val - This is the value to change said location on the board too

      • trackMoves

        public static void trackMoves(int[] move)
        this function takes in a triple and pushes it to the list of move history
        Parameters:
        move - the move that was just made as a triple {player, old position, new position}

      • isPossiblePlace

        public static boolean isPossiblePlace(int[] a,
                                      int p)
        The isPossiblePlace method calculates if it is possible for the player to place a piece in a location.
        Parameters:
        int[] - a the array with postitions of the board.
        int - p The location the user wants to put the piece in.
        Returns:
        a boolean stating if a piece can be placed in a specified position.

      • isPossibleBoard

        public static boolean isPossibleBoard()
        The isPossibleBoard checks if a board is legal and playable or not.
        Returns:
        A boolean stating if a board is playable.

      • isBlocked

        public static boolean isBlocked(int[] boardPositions,
                                int player)
        The isBlocked function checks if a player is blocked, that is they have no pieces capable of legal moves.
        Parameters:
        int[] - boardPositions This is the array with the board positions.
        int - player Indicates Player 1 or Player 2
        Returns:
        A boolean stating whether a player is blocked or not.

      • checkWin

        public static int checkWin(int mover)
        check if a player win the game.
        Returns:
        return an int value representing who wins. 0 for no one wins,1 for red wins,2 for blue wins

      • canEat

        public static boolean canEat(int currentmove,
                             int position)
        This function checks if the current player can perform the eat step.
        Parameters:
        currentmove - the player that is making the current move
        position - the position of the dice selected by the current player moves to
        Returns:
        return true if the current user can eat the opponet's dice

      • canBeAte

        public static boolean canBeAte(int position,
                               int DiceCoulor)
        This function checks if the a dice on the specific board position can be ate
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the dice that the current player want to eat
        DiceCoulor - the color of the dice that the current player want to eat
        Returns:
        return true if the selected dice can be ate and false otherwise

      • canMoveTo

        public static boolean canMoveTo(int from,
                                int to)
        check if the move is valid
        Parameters:
        from - the start position of the dice be selected
        to - the position the selected dice wants to move to
        Returns:
        return ture if the dice can be moved to the selected position
